intro: Atherosperma muticum, commonly known as the mountain ash or swamp gum, is a small to medium-sized tree native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and elliptical, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters, followed by woody, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers moist, well-drained conditions, often found in swampy or wetland areas.
